parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions the "candidates of the social-democratic team for the Senate and the Chamber of Deputies". While it doesn't name specific candidates, it clearly refers to a specific political party (PSD) and their candidates participating in the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The hashtags and general message are aimed at a broad segment of the population, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to encourage voters to support the PSD candidates in the parliamentary elections. Phrases like "Vote responsibly in the parliamentary elections," "We must go to the polls and vote for balance and those who have proven in the last three years that they know how to govern," and the use of hashtags like #EchipaPSD and #PentruBacau clearly aim to influence voting behavior in favor of the PSD.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. The post lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It's a clear advocacy piece promoting a specific political party and its candidates, not an unbiased presentation of information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While presented as a personal opinion by Cristina Breahnă-Pravaț, the content is clearly designed to promote a political party and influence the outcome of the election. It's not a personal reflection unrelated to the electoral process.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>515979414777457</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by Cristina Pravat, promotes the PSD candidates in the parliamentary elections.  The post uses persuasive language and calls to action to encourage voters to support the PSD.  The hashtags and overall message are clearly designed to influence the election outcome.  While the post doesn't explicitly name individual candidates, its reference to the "social-democratic team" and its call to vote for them constitutes electoral propaganda. The targeting of the ad to Bacau County further indicates a localized effort to influence voters. The ad's end date (1732953600) corresponds to November 23rd, 2024, which is after the official end of the electoral campaign period.  Therefore, the post violates the legal restrictions on electoral propaganda after the campaign's conclusion.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PSD Candidates (Unspecified)</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PSD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Cristina Pravat, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID 515979414777457) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidații Partidului Social Democrat (PSD) la alegerile parlamentare, folosind un limbaj persuasiv și îndemnuri la vot. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 400-499 RON, a atins 35.000-40.000 de impresii, vizând județul Bacău.  Efectul electoral este clar, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea PSD. Fraze precum „Votați Responsabil la Parlamentare”, „Trebuie să ieșim la vot și să votăm echilibrul și pe cei care au dovedit… candidații echipei social-democrate” și hashtag-urile #EchipaPSD și #PentruBacău demonstrează intenția de a influența votul.  Această postare constituie propagandă electorală după încheierea campaniei, fiind astfel ilegală.  Datele de contact ale reclamantei sunt cristina.pravat@outlook.com și +40735598429.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
